alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Mathews; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of eastern Virginia and southeast Virginia, including the following counties, in eastern Virginia, Mathews and Middlesex. In southeast Virginia, Gloucester. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gloucester Courthouse, Gloucester Point, Deltaville, Hayes, Hartfield, Blakes, Wicomico, Fort Nonsense, Dutton, Ware Neck, Pinero, Soles, Harcum, Beulah, Ark, Selden, Cash, White Marsh, Stampers and Cobbs Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
